ci-logs/pr-722.body.json:1:{"body":"This PR addresses issue #719 by:\n\n- Handling usage-limit outcomes for Claude, Codex, and OpenCode by surfacing a dedicated PR comment with reset time and resume instructions when `--attach-logs` is used.\n- Ensuring the run is marked as failed so status reflects the failure rather than success.\n- Adding a case study with analysis under `docs/case-studies/issue-719/` and `docs/case-studies/issue-719-usage-limit/`.\n\nKey changes:\n- `src/solve.mjs`: Pass `isUsageLimit`, `limitResetTime`, `toolName`, and `resumeCommand` to `attachLogToGitHub` when a tool run fails due to usage limit; fall back to generic failure template otherwise.\n- `src/github.lib.mjs`: Dedicated \"Usage Limit Reached\" comment format incl. reset time, session ID, resume instructions, and optional attached logs.\n- `src/claude.lib.mjs`, `src/codex.lib.mjs`, `src/opencode.lib.mjs`: Robust usage-limit detection with reset time extraction and clear console messaging.\n- `src/solve.validation.lib.mjs`: Accepts reset time formats with or without space before AM/PM (e.g., `12:16 PM` or `12:16PM`) to support auto-continue.\n\nCase study:\n- Overview and analysis: `docs/case-studies/issue-719-usage-limit/00-OVERVIEW.md`\n- Evidence and timeline: `docs/case-studies/issue-719-usage-limit/03-EVIDENCE.md`\n- Referenced logs: `docs/case-studies/issue-719/comment-3521528245.md` and JSON sources.\n\nAdditional notes:\n- Added `experiments/parse-reset-time.mjs` to validate time parsing for auto-continue logic.\n\nFixes #719\n"}

logs/search-docs.txt:14:docs/case-studies/issue-719-usage-limit/00-OVERVIEW.md:11:The current implementation of AI tools (claude, codex, opencode) does not handle usage limit errors properly. When a tool hits a usage limit, the error message is buried in logs and the command is shown as successful instead of failed, making it difficult for users to quickly identify the problem.

logs/search-docs.txt:294:docs/case-studies/issue-719/case-study.md:4:- Problem: When usage limits are reached for AI tools (Claude, Codex, OpenCode), the run was surfaced as a success comment with exit code 0, confusing users. PR comments also lacked a clear ‚Äúlimit reached‚Äù message and reset-time guidance.
logs/search-docs.txt:295:docs/case-studies/issue-719/case-study.md:5:- Impact: Users had to dig into logs to discover rate/usage limits. Comment formatting did not distinguish usage-limit from generic failures.
logs/search-docs.txt:297:docs/case-studies/issue-719/case-study.md:9:- 2025-11-12 11:47:04Z: Session starts. Error: "You've hit your usage limit... try again at 12:16 PM." (see issue body)
logs/search-docs.txt:299:docs/case-studies/issue-719/case-study.md:19:- The tool libraries (Claude, Codex, OpenCode) already detect usage limits and expose `limitReached` and `limitResetTime`.
logs/search-docs.txt:300:docs/case-studies/issue-719/case-study.md:24:- In `src/solve.mjs`, when a tool run fails, pass `isUsageLimit`, `limitResetTime`, `toolName`, and a `resumeCommand` to `attachLogToGitHub`. This triggers a dedicated "Usage Limit Reached" comment with reset-time and clear resume instructions. Generic `errorMessage` is sent only when not a usage-limit case.

logs/case-719-usage-00.txt:1:# Case Study: Usage Limit Error Handling (Issue #719)
logs/case-719-usage-00.txt:11:The current implementation of AI tools (claude, codex, opencode) does not handle usage limit errors properly. When a tool hits a usage limit, the error message is buried in logs and the command is shown as successful instead of failed, making it difficult for users to quickly identify the problem.
logs/case-719-usage-00.txt:21:[2025-11-12T11:47:04.639Z] [INFO] {"type":"error","message":"You've hit your usage limit. To get more access now, send a request to your admin or try again at 12:16 PM."}
logs/case-719-usage-00.txt:22:{"type":"turn.failed","error":{"message":"You've hit your usage limit. To get more access now, send a request to your admin or try again at 12:16 PM."}}
logs/case-719-usage-00.txt:29:1. **Show command as failed** - When a usage limit is reached, the command should be marked as failed, not successful
logs/case-719-usage-00.txt:32:   - What happened (usage limit reached)
logs/case-719-usage-00.txt:34:   - How to proceed once the limit resets

logs/pr-722.diff:592:+This document compiles concrete evidence, logs, and a reconstructed timeline for Issue #719: usage limit handling across tools (Claude, Codex, OpenCode).
logs/pr-722.diff:599:+- 2025-11-12 12:32 UTC ‚Äî Issue opened with logs showing: "You've hit your usage limit. ‚Ä¶ try again at 12:16 PM." (source issue body)
logs/pr-722.diff:600:+- 2025-11-13 03:54 UTC ‚Äî Run detects session usage limit in Claude output; command previously returned exit code 0. PR comments added usage-limit detection and formatted messaging in tools and PR comments.
logs/pr-722.diff:625:+## Usage Limit Evidence (From Issue Logs)
logs/pr-722.diff:627:+User-provided logs demonstrate Anthropic usage limit pattern including reset time:
logs/pr-722.diff:630:+{"type":"error","message":"You've hit your usage limit. To get more access now, send a request to your admin or try again at 12:16 PM."}
logs/pr-722.diff:631:+{"type":"turn.failed","error":{"message":"You've hit your usage limit. To get more access now, send a request to your admin or try again at 12:16 PM."}}
logs/pr-722.diff:635:+- Detects usage limit via `detectUsageLimit(message)` with reset time extraction.
logs/pr-722.diff:636:+- Returns `{ success: false, limitReached: true, limitResetTime }` from tool executors.
logs/pr-722.diff:638:+- `attachLogToGitHub()` in `src/github.lib.mjs` formats a dedicated "Usage Limit Reached" PR/issue comment including reset time, session ID, resume instructions, and log details when `--attach-logs` is used.
logs/pr-722.diff:670:+# Case Study: Usage Limit Handling Across Tools (Issue #719)
logs/pr-722.diff:673:+- Problem: When usage limits are reached for AI tools (Claude, Codex, OpenCode), the run was surfaced as a success comment with exit code 0, confusing users. PR comments also lacked a clear ‚Äúlimit reached‚Äù message and reset-time guidance.
logs/pr-722.diff:674:+- Impact: Users had to dig into logs to discover rate/usage limits. Comment formatting did not distinguish usage-limit from generic failures.
logs/pr-722.diff:678:+- 2025-11-12 11:47:04Z: Session starts. Error: "You've hit your usage limit... try again at 12:16 PM." (see issue body)
logs/pr-722.diff:679:+- 2025-11-13 03:54:27Z: Claude returns a result with `subtype: success` but `is_error: true` and text "Weekly limit reached ‚àô resets 5am" (see related comment logs). The harness detected an error, but exit code remained 0 and comment formatting looked like success.
logs/pr-722.diff:688:+- The tool libraries (Claude, Codex, OpenCode) already detect usage limits and expose `limitReached` and `limitResetTime`.
logs/pr-722.diff:693:+- In `src/solve.mjs`, when a tool run fails, pass `isUsageLimit`, `limitResetTime`, `toolName`, and a `resumeCommand` to `attachLogToGitHub`. This triggers a dedicated "Usage Limit Reached" comment with reset-time and clear resume instructions. Generic `errorMessage` is sent only when not a usage-limit case.

logs/pr-722.diff:6082:+docs/case-studies/issue-719/case-study.md:24:- In `src/solve.mjs`, when a tool run fails, pass `isUsageLimit`, `limitResetTime`, `toolName`, and a `resumeCommand` to `attachLogToGitHub`. This triggers a dedicated "Usage Limit Reached" comment with reset-time and clear resume instructions. Generic `errorMessage` is sent only when not a usage-limit case.

logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:728:+This document compiles concrete evidence, logs, and a reconstructed timeline for Issue #719: usage limit handling across tools (Claude, Codex, OpenCode).
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:735:+- 2025-11-12 12:32 UTC ‚Äî Issue opened with logs showing: "You've hit your usage limit. ‚Ä¶ try again at 12:16 PM." (source issue body)
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:736:+- 2025-11-13 03:54 UTC ‚Äî Run detects session usage limit in Claude output; command previously returned exit code 0. PR comments added usage-limit detection and formatted messaging in tools and PR comments.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:761:+## Usage Limit Evidence (From Issue Logs)
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:763:+User-provided logs demonstrate Anthropic usage limit pattern including reset time:
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:766:+{"type":"error","message":"You've hit your usage limit. To get more access now, send a request to your admin or try again at 12:16 PM."}
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:767:+{"type":"turn.failed","error":{"message":"You've hit your usage limit. To get more access now, send a request to your admin or try again at 12:16 PM."}}
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:771:+- Detects usage limit via `detectUsageLimit(message)` with reset time extraction.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:772:+- Returns `{ success: false, limitReached: true, limitResetTime }` from tool executors.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:774:+- `attachLogToGitHub()` in `src/github.lib.mjs` formats a dedicated "Usage Limit Reached" PR/issue comment including reset time, session ID, resume instructions, and log details when `--attach-logs` is used.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:806:+# Case Study: Usage Limit Handling Across Tools (Issue #719)
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:809:+- Problem: When usage limits are reached for AI tools (Claude, Codex, OpenCode), the run was surfaced as a success comment with exit code 0, confusing users. PR comments also lacked a clear ‚Äúlimit reached‚Äù message and reset-time guidance.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:810:+- Impact: Users had to dig into logs to discover rate/usage limits. Comment formatting did not distinguish usage-limit from generic failures.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:814:+- 2025-11-12 11:47:04Z: Session starts. Error: "You've hit your usage limit... try again at 12:16 PM." (see issue body)
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:815:+- 2025-11-13 03:54:27Z: Claude returns a result with `subtype: success` but `is_error: true` and text "Weekly limit reached ‚àô resets 5am" (see related comment logs). The harness detected an error, but exit code remained 0 and comment formatting looked like success.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:824:+- The tool libraries (Claude, Codex, OpenCode) already detect usage limits and expose `limitReached` and `limitResetTime`.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:829:+- In `src/solve.mjs`, when a tool run fails, pass `isUsageLimit`, `limitResetTime`, `toolName`, and a `resumeCommand` to `attachLogToGitHub`. This triggers a dedicated "Usage Limit Reached" comment with reset-time and clear resume instructions. Generic `errorMessage` is sent only when not a usage-limit case.

logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:1348:+# Case Study: Usage Limit Handling Across Tools (Issue #719)
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:1351:+- Problem: When usage limits are reached for AI tools (Claude, Codex, OpenCode), the run was surfaced as a success comment with exit code 0, confusing users. PR comments also lacked a clear ‚Äúlimit reached‚Äù message and reset-time guidance.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:1352:+- Impact: Users had to dig into logs to discover rate/usage limits. Comment formatting did not distinguish usage-limit from generic failures.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:1356:+- 2025-11-12 11:47:04Z: Session starts. Error: "You've hit your usage limit... try again at 12:16 PM." (see issue body)
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:1357:+- 2025-11-13 03:54:27Z: Claude returns a result with `subtype: success` but `is_error: true` and text "Weekly limit reached ‚àô resets 5am" (see related comment logs). The harness detected an error, but exit code remained 0 and comment formatting looked like success.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:1366:+- The tool libraries (Claude, Codex, OpenCode) already detect usage limits and expose `limitReached` and `limitResetTime`.
logs/40-pr-diff-722.txt:1371:+- In `src/solve.mjs`, when a tool run fails, pass `isUsageLimit`, `limitResetTime`, `toolName`, and a `resumeCommand` to `attachLogToGitHub`. This triggers a dedicated "Usage Limit Reached" comment with reset-time and clear resume instructions. Generic `errorMessage` is sent only when not a usage-limit case.
